meanings.definition: To lure or entice (someone or something) away from a place or into a trap.
meanings.sent1: The clever hunter decoyed the ducks into his trap with a shiny object.
meanings.sent2: The shiny bait decoyed the fish towards the fishing net.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon decoyed the curious cat away from its food.
meanings.sent4: The magician decoyed the audience's attention with a flashy trick.
meanings.sent5: The spy decoyed the enemy soldiers by pretending to be one of them.

meanings.definition: To attract or lead (someone or something) into a particular situation or course of action.
meanings.sent1: The delicious smell of freshly baked cookies decoyed the children into the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: The promise of a fun adventure decoyed the group towards the mysterious cave.
meanings.sent3: The shiny new toy decoyed the puppy away from chewing on the shoes.
meanings.sent4: The exciting music decoyed the crowd to the dance floor.
meanings.sent5: The bright lights of the city decoyed the young artist to pursue her dreams.
